title:
SHMT: Self-supervised Hierarchical Makeup Transfer via Latent Diffusion
  Models
authors:
Zhaoyang Sun and Shengwu Xiong and Yaxiong Chen and Fei Du and Weihua
  Chen and Fan Wang and Yi Rong
abstract:
This paper studies the challenging task of makeup transfer, which aims to
apply diverse makeup styles precisely and naturally to a given facial image.
Due to the absence of paired data, current methods typically synthesize
sub-optimal pseudo ground truths to guide the model training, resulting in low
makeup fidelity. Additionally, different makeup styles generally have varying
effects on the person face, but existing methods struggle to deal with this
diversity. To address these issues, we propose a novel Self-supervised
Hierarchical Makeup Transfer (SHMT) method via latent diffusion models.
Following a "decoupling-and-reconstruction" paradigm, SHMT works in a
self-supervised manner, freeing itself from the misguidance of imprecise
pseudo-paired data. Furthermore, to accommodate a variety of makeup styles,
hierarchical texture details are decomposed via a Laplacian pyramid and
selectively introduced to the content representation. Finally, we design a
novel Iterative Dual Alignment (IDA) module that dynamically adjusts the
injection condition of the diffusion model, allowing the alignment errors
caused by the domain gap between content and makeup representations to be
corrected. Extensive quantitative and qualitative analyses demonstrate the
effectiveness of our method. Our code is available at
\url{https://github.com/Snowfallingplum/SHMT}.
subjects: Computer Science/Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition
